comments.text: If this class ever needs more state history in the future the px4lib block delay library might be useful.
I will consider
"now" was just set several lines above.  So you're basically just measuring the time between these lines, which will be a very small number.  Is this intended?  Please address the design.
Yes it is intended, and has significance, it is used later to calculate time since armed.
Curly braces around case constructs.
Suggest m_state style attribute name for easier reading.
boolean isLandDetected = FALSE;

Is total flight time currently being used? If so, I would suggest updating this so that LD's HK has a total flight time uint64 that can be displayed on the HUD. We may also want to move a total flight time calculation away from LD to VM in the future.
Add some comment blocks before each function.  Also add more commenting inside the functions.  I can see what you're doing.  Thats fairly simple.  Describe why you're doing what your doing.

Avoid calling functions inside conditionals.  Use a variable assignment outside the conditional instead.  Functions inside conditionals can make debugging a little more confusing and can open yourself up to possible accidental violation of no conditionals-with-side-effects coding standard.
Don't define inline functions.

Move these initializers to a InitData function that is called at initialization.  Due to an issue with Linux, these initializers will not be executed if the application is reloaded.  They will be initialized if they're put into an InitData function.
Doesn't make much sense to include extern "C" in this case.  We use that for C headers, but C++ headers with class definitions won't even compile in C anyway.

Global comment.  Does "default" make sense anymore now that we have parameters in a table?  Maybe "suggested", but "default" gives me the impression that it will be this value if I don't load a table.  If this is not true, change this to "suggested".
Limits should also go in the table verification function.  Make sure you have a table verification function.
Const if not modified later.
return (); style
Magic numbers. Suggest 50% threshold macro, 75% etc.
Magic number.
Same comment on "now" as the previous function. Calculated above a very short time ago.
Check all comment blocks for RH alignment.
return (); style
return (); style.
const if not modified.
const if not modified.
magic number.
const float if not modified later.
Recommend explicitly handling rollover.
Mixed variable declaration style. Camel case vs underscore separated.
global: brace style.

This initializer list (constructor/destructor) is inline. I don't think we have a style issue with that. Maybe add some comments though that separate the inline constructor, inline destructor and the next function declaration.
Global comment: bool vs cfs boolean.
global comment: nit: return (iStatus);
global comment: nit: space between assignment operator.
These values should probably be a macro so they can be easily updated in the platform config or header file.
m_ to indicate a class attribute increases readability.
nit: space between includes.

Move these initialization statements to a non-constructor function and call it in your AppInit function.  A linux problem could cause these variables to be non-zero at reinitialization if reloaded.  Making this change will prevent that from being an issue.
Don't use intrinsic data types.  Use "int32".
What is this publish_counter variable?  Will this set the variables to false when it rolls over to 0?
Use the config table parameters directly rather than copying them.
Global comment.  Remove all magic numbers.  Maybe these should be CFE tables, mission config, or platform configs?
Convert these magic numbers to CFE tables.
This loop should be explicitly limited to prevent infinite looping.

Revisit this block.  "hasEvents" is 1 when the application successfully registered with CFE EVS.  CFE_ES_WriteToSysLog() should be called when the application cannot successfully register with CFE EVS.
This is the SCH pipe, not the CMD pipe.  This comment applies to all the messages below.  They're all SCH pipe, not CMD pipe.
No events registered.  Register all your events here.

Rule 6-6-4 states for any iteration statement, which in this case is the while loop, there shall be no more than one break or goto statement used for loop termination. See if it is possible to restructure the code
May want to change the 1 to true, Rule 5–0–13 states "The condition of an if-statement and the condition of an iteration-statement shall have type boolean."
Break is required, in case a future modification turns this into a case Refer: Rule 6-4-3, A switch statement shall be a well-formed switch statement.
Remove comments styled as //comment
return (state);
return ();
return (bResult);
return (iStatus);
return (iStatus);
return (iStatus);
return (iStatus);
nit: space between includes.
Not an issue. I really like having the param limits in doxy. I don't think all the apps do this and they should.
Add doxy to this class's functions and member attributes
Add doxy for state
Explicitly give event enumerations a value
Address boilerplate todo
Write a table validation function here
Maybe rename this to GetMinimalThrust. Seeing MinimalThrust() in code looks like it would actually set actuators to minimal thrust
Uncomment else block for coding standard, but don't spam the console with an event saying vehicle in flight. Maybe put a filter on the event
Put this comment above the function. This looks like a comment for CurrentLandDetectedMsg
Remove commented out code
Make 500000 a macro in the platform config or param
Make this and the next if block else ifs, and then have an else at the end
Use the warning enumerations in these conditionals for readability
Should this be an else if? Every flight mode we use controls attitude so this will always set toThrottle to .15f and override the previous value
Line up closing comment with other
Remove commented out returns and use a goto pattern in this function
What does 2.5 represent? Maybe make this a param or platform config macro.
All "if, else if" blocks need and else
Remove commented out return. Might want to use a goto here since none of the other code needs to be executed
Initialize variables on declaration
These magic numbers should be params

CFE boolean types should be set equal to CFE macros for TRUE or FALSE. This is an implicit cast from c++ type false to 0, the value of FALSE. It works, but should be switched to the CFE booleans for consistency.
Have goto exit tag code start on the next line
Global comment. Update all functions to coding style of project with open braces being on the nextline.
Add a new line between each doxy and function pair
Add "False otherwise" at the end of this comment
Global comment. This is the return for the previous function but is in all of the following functions in this file. These all should be updated to the specific function return
Global comment. This is the description for the previous function but is in all of the following functions in this file. These all should be updated to the specific function description
Should this be a formal parameter or something defined in the platform config?
Is this variable being used for anything? We shouldn't manage rates inside of the application.
Change app variable names to project style of camel case with the first letter also being capital. Ie: FreefallHistory
Start enumerations values with apps name like: LD_FLYING
Add a new line between each doxy comment and declaration pair
Start doxy comments with a capital letter
Add license text here
Address boilerplate todo
Are we going to list all reqs in doxy or should we somehow reference JIRA here?
Remove this section since LD has no CDS tables
Is 8 seconds a parameter? If so specify param name here
Maybe rephrase this to be: "never report landed if: " since you have bullet points beneath that expand on the logic of it.
Is the threshold a parameter?
What parameter?
